channel.title: [PI] Items displaying wrong stats (repost)
channel.description:
I guess I have to re-post this since it was already buried from nobody replying. :\ Here it goes..
So I will try to explain myself as best as I can.
None of my items are showing their right stats for some reason, the Item Config.cfg has all the right stats for the items. But when I wear the item in-game and look at my stats they are completely different from the cfg file. I can't seem to figure out why this problem is happening and I am getting NO errors from Eclipse or anywhere else.. Just as an example here is what I mean: This is the Item Config.cfg for Fire cape: [code] item = 6570 Fire_cape A_cape_of_fire. 0 0 0 1 1 1 1 1 11 11 11 11 11 4 2 item = 10566 Fire_cape A_cape_of_fire. 0 0 0 1 1 1 1 1 11 11 11 11 11 4 2 item = 10637 Fire_cape A_cape_of_fire. 0 0 0 1 1 1 1 1 11 11 11 11 11 4 2 [/code]
The stats my Fire cape displays when worn in-game: [URL=http://s425.photobucket.com/user/enahsh2o/media/Firecapebadstats.png.html][IMG]http://i425.photobucket.com/albums/pp334/enahsh2o/Firecapebadstats.png[/img][/URL]
I figured out that the first stat bonus of an item in the Item Config.cfg is the bonus that you receive in-game. So like for the Fire Cape the first bonus is 1 so you get +1 in every stat. No idea why it is doing this though or how to fix it, so please help. :\ That is what it is like for all items except different random stats but they are all the same like +1 for all or +2 for all etc..
This is a PI base. Side Note: I know 100% that there isn't a space somewhere in the cfg file, also that would give me an error which I have none, but I checked that anyways. Duplicate of items isn't the problem either. Also, if you don't know what the problem might be please at least guess for my sake. I have tried looking through everything (I am still new) I could think of but can't find the problem. If there is any part of code you want to see, just ask and you shall receive. Thank you in advance. :]

item.title: [PI] Items displaying wrong stats (repost)
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“enahsh2o, post:18, topic:528393”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=647144.msg4352208#msg4352208 date=1376855394]
Though Matzie ultimately gave you the answer, you’re welcome for the part I did do
[/quote]
Lol true, but for me you both were a help and anybody willing to even offer help should always be thanked anyways.[/quote]

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:528393”]See this?:

c.getOutStream().createFrame(34); c.getOutStream().writeWord(6); c.getOutStream().writeWord(1688); c.getOutStream().writeByte(slot); c.getOutStream().writeWord(0); c.getOutStream().writeByte(0); c.flushOutStream(); c.updateRequired = true; c.setAppearanceUpdateRequired(true);

That’s why I think it’s handled client sided.[/quote]

If i am not mistaken that is part of the “resetEquipment” method, all that does is set the selected equipment “slot” to 0. This is incharge of showing the item on the menu shown.(or in this case, removing it)

Read full topic

the strange symbol is obviously an error in transversing O_o'
You can remove or comment out the debug line once all your error lines are gone, remember that it requires a tab between the tokens. (except for the item = id)

item.title: [PI] Items displaying wrong stats (repost)
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

edit nvm:
somewhere you have too few values in your .cfg file.
To find the line with the issue:

public boolean loadItemList(String FileName) { String line = ""; String token = ""; String token2 = ""; String token2_2 = ""; String[] token3 = new String[10]; boolean EndOfFile = false; BufferedReader characterfile = null; try { characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./Data/cfg/"+FileName)); } catch(FileNotFoundException fileex) { Misc.println(FileName+": file not found."); return false; } try { line = characterfile.readLine(); } catch(IOException ioexception) { Misc.println(FileName+": error loading file."); return false; } while(EndOfFile == false && line != null) { line = line.trim(); System.out.println(line);//the last line that appears in your server before it crashes, is the one that is too short. int spot = line.indexOf("="); if (spot > -1) { token = line.substring(0, spot); token = token.trim(); token2 = line.substring(spot + 1); token2 = token2.trim(); token2_2 = token2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t"); token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t"); token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t"); token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t"); token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t"); token3 = token2_2.split("\t"); if (token.equals("item")) { int[] Bonuses = new int[12]; for (int i = 0; i < 12; i++) { if (token3[(6 + i)] != null) { Bonuses[i] = Integer.parseInt(token3[(6 + i)]); } else { break; } } newItemList(Integer.parseInt(token3[0]), token3[1].replaceAll("_", " "), token3[2].replaceAll("_", " "), Double.parseDouble(token3[4]), Double.parseDouble(token3[4]), Double.parseDouble(token3[6]), Bonuses); } } else { if (line.equals("[ENDOFITEMLIST]")) { try { characterfile.close(); } catch(IOException ioexception) { } return true; } }

Read full topic

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:528393”]See this?:
That’s why I think it’s handled client sided.[/quote]
Okay, but I think the reason the stats aren’t coming in correctly is because of the 2nd post I made about the

if (token3[(6 + i)] != null) {
                     Bonuses = Integer.parseInt(token3[(6 + i)]);

I believe that something isn’t right and it is making it only read the first bonus in item config and not all of them. The problem I have now is knowing what to change to make it read all of the bonuses and not just the first 1.

item.title: [PI] Items displaying wrong stats (repost)
item.dc:creator: @enahsh2o enahsh2o
item.description:
@enahsh2o wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Yes I mean the code for the interface, because that seems to be the issue. I need to see how the stats are loaded onto the interface…

This might be what you are looking for? I am still new to Java so reading it isn’t the easiest for me but it seems to be the right thing to me. If not, let me know and I will keep looking.

		if (c.getOutStream() != null && c != null) {
			if (c.playerEquipment[slot] > -1) {
				if (addItem(c.playerEquipment[slot], c.playerEquipmentN[slot])) {
					c.playerEquipment[slot] = -1;
					c.playerEquipmentN[slot] = 0;
					sendWeapon(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon],
							getItemName(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]));
					resetBonus();
					getBonus();
					writeBonus();
					c.getCombat().getPlayerAnimIndex(
							c.getItems()
							.getItemName(
									c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon])
									.toLowerCase());
					c.getOutStream().createFrame(34);
					c.getOutStream().writeWord(6);
					c.getOutStream().writeWord(1688);
					c.getOutStream().writeByte(slot);
					c.getOutStream().writeWord(0);
					c.getOutStream().writeByte(0);
					c.flushOutStream();
					c.updateRequired = true;
					c.setAppearanceUpdateRequired(true);
				}
			}
		}

EDIT;
or this?:

	public void getBonus() {
		for (final int element : c.playerEquipment) {
			if (element > -1) {
				for (int j = 0; j < Config.ITEM_LIMIT; j++) {
					if (Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j] != null) {
						if (Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j].itemId == element) {
							for (int k = 0; k < c.playerBonus.length; k++) {
								c.playerBonus[k] += Server.itemHandler.ItemList[j].Bonuses[k];
							}
							break;
						}

item.title: [PI] Items displaying wrong stats (repost)
item.dc:creator: @enahsh2o enahsh2o
item.description:
@enahsh2o wrote:

sk8rdude461:

Show us the code for the interface? (I forget if it’s client or server sided.)

If you mean the code for the equipment interface, then I have no idea where that would be, but I doubt that is the issue.

In the meanwhile I tried finding the problem and I found something interesting that I believe might be the problem.
I changed the LoadItemList part in ItemHandler.java very slightly and it caused the error you would usually get when you have a space in your Item config file.
Here is what I did, I changed:

for (int i = 0; i < 12; i++) {
						if (token3[(6 + 0)] != null) {
							Bonuses[i] = Integer.parseInt(token3[(6 + 0)]);

To:

for (int i = 0; i < 12; i++) {
						if (token3[(6 + i)] != null) {
							Bonuses[i] = Integer.parseInt(token3[(6 + i)]);

If you can’t see I changed the “0” (zero) to “i”.

And here is the error I get as well:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError
Caused by: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 17
	at game.item.ItemHandler.loadItemList(ItemHandler.java:248)
	at game.item.ItemHandler.<init>(ItemHandler.java:85)
	at game.Server.<clinit>(Server.java:62)

Here is the full code for LoadItemList if that helps at all:

	public boolean loadItemList(String FileName) {
		String line = "";
		String token = "";
		String token2 = "";
		String token2_2 = "";
		String[] token3 = new String[10];
		boolean EndOfFile = false;
		BufferedReader characterfile = null;
		try {
			characterfile = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("./Data/cfg/"+FileName));
		} catch(FileNotFoundException fileex) {
			Misc.println(FileName+": file not found.");
			return false;
		}
		try {
			line = characterfile.readLine();
		} catch(IOException ioexception) {
			Misc.println(FileName+": error loading file.");
			return false;
		}
		while(EndOfFile == false && line != null) {
			line = line.trim();
			int spot = line.indexOf("=");
			if (spot > -1) {
				token = line.substring(0, spot);
				token = token.trim();
				token2 = line.substring(spot + 1);
				token2 = token2.trim();
				token2_2 = token2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token2_2 = token2_2.replaceAll("\t\t", "\t");
				token3 = token2_2.split("\t");
				if (token.equals("item")) {
					int[] Bonuses = new int[12];
					for (int i = 0; i < 12; i++) {
						if (token3[(6 + i)] != null) {
							Bonuses[i] = Integer.parseInt(token3[(6 + i)]);
						} else {
							break;
						}
					}
					newItemList(Integer.parseInt(token3[0]), token3[1].replaceAll("_", " "), token3[2].replaceAll("_", " "), Double.parseDouble(token3[4]), Double.parseDouble(token3[4]), Double.parseDouble(token3[6]), Bonuses);
				}
			} else {
				if (line.equals("[ENDOFITEMLIST]")) {
					try { characterfile.close(); } catch(IOException ioexception) { }
					return true;
				}
			}

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Items displaying wrong stats (repost)
item.dc:creator: @enahsh2o enahsh2o
item.description:
@enahsh2o wrote:

I guess I have to re-post this since it was already buried from nobody replying. :\ Here it goes…

So I will try to explain myself as best as I can.

None of my items are showing their right stats for some reason, the Item Config.cfg has all the right stats for the items. But when I wear the item in-game and look at my stats they are completely different from the cfg file. I can’t seem to figure out why this problem is happening and I am getting NO errors from Eclipse or anywhere else…
Just as an example here is what I mean:
This is the Item Config.cfg for Fire cape:

item = 6570 	Fire_cape	A_cape_of_fire.	0	0	0	1	1	1	1	1	11	11	11	11	11	4	2
item = 10566	Fire_cape	A_cape_of_fire.	0	0	0	1	1	1	1	1	11	11	11	11	11	4	2
item = 10637	Fire_cape	A_cape_of_fire.	0	0	0	1	1	1	1	1	11	11	11	11	11	4	2

The stats my Fire cape displays when worn in-game:

I figured out that the first stat bonus of an item in the Item Config.cfg is the bonus that you receive in-game. So like for the Fire Cape the first bonus is 1 so you get +1 in every stat. No idea why it is doing this though or how to fix it, so please help. :
That is what it is like for all items except different random stats but they are all the same like +1 for all or +2 for all etc…

This is a PI base.
Side Note: I know 100% that there isn’t a space somewhere in the cfg file, also that would give me an error which I have none, but I checked that anyways.
Duplicate of items isn’t the problem either.
Also, if you don’t know what the problem might be please at least guess for my sake. I have tried looking through everything (I am still new) I could think of but can’t find the problem. If there is any part of code you want to see, just ask and you shall receive.
Thank you in advance. :]

Read full topic
